He learns the nobility of the words, the comprehensiveness of the Word (جوامع الكلم), the reality of *Kun* (Be!), and its specialization with the word of Command, not the word of the past, future, or present. He learns the appearance of the two letters from this word, despite its being composed of three, and why the third, intermediary, Isthmus-like (برزخية) letter—the spiritual *waw* (الواو الروحانية)—was omitted, which grants the effect of the angel in the constitution of the created thing, despite the disappearance of its essence. He learns the secret of formation (التكوين) from this heaven, and the fact that Jesus gives life to the dead and creates the form of the bird and breathes into its form, and the formation of the bird as a bird—is it by the permission of Allah, or is Jesus's depiction of the creation of the bird and his breathing into it by the permission of Allah? And to which verbal act does His saying <<بِإِذْنِي>> (by My permission) and <<بِإِذْنِ الله>> (by the permission of Allah) relate? Is the operative word *yakūn* (it is) or *tanfukh* (you breathe)? According to the People of Allah [أهل الله], the operative word is *yakūn*. According to those who affirm causes and the people of states, the operative word is *tanfukh*. Whoever enters this heaven and meets Jesus and John will inevitably attain the knowledge of this. The independent seeker does not attain this—and I mean the attainment of direct experience (ذوق). Jesus is the Spirit of Allah (روح الله), and John has Life (الحياة). Just as the Spirit and Life are inseparable, so too are these two Prophets, Jesus and John, inseparable because of the secret they carry.

[Jesus Possesses Both Paths of the Science of Alchemy]

Indeed, Jesus possesses both paths of the science of Alchemy [الكيمياء]: Creation (الإنشاء), which is his creation of the bird from clay and the breathing, so the form appeared through the hands and the flight through the breath (النفس). This is the method of Creation [الإنشاء] in the science of Alchemy that we presented at the beginning of the chapter. The second path is the removal of accidental defects, which in Jesus is the healing of the blind and the leper. These are defects that afflicted them in the womb, which is the function of formation (التكوين). From here, this follower attains the knowledge of natural and spiritual measure and balance, due to Jesus combining both matters. From this heaven, this follower attains the scientific life (الحياة العلمية) by which he revives hearts, as in His saying: <<أَوَمَنْ كَانَ مَيْتًا فَأَحْيَيْنَاهُ>> (Is he who was dead and We gave him life?). This is a comprehensive Presence [حضرة جامعة] containing something of everything. In it is the angel entrusted with the sperm in the sixth month. From this Presence comes the spiritual support (الإمداد) for orators and writers, but not for poets. Since Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, possessed the comprehensiveness of the Word (جوامع الكلم), he was addressed from this Presence, and it was said: <<وَمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ الشِّعْرَ>> (And We did not teach him poetry), because he was sent as an explainer and detailer, and poetry comes from feeling (الشعور), so its place is generalization, not detailing, which is contrary to clarification (البيان). From here, you learn the transformations of matters. From here, spiritual states (الأحوال) are granted to their possessors. Everything that appears in the elemental world of the nominal marvels (النيرنجيات الأسمائية) is from this heaven. As for the talismans (القلقطيرات), they are from outside this Presence, but if they exist, their spirits are from this heaven, not the essences of their forms that carry their spirits. When the knowledge of these existents and the speed of revival within them—whose nature is not to accept that except over a long period—is attained, that is from the knowledge of Jesus, not from the command revealed in that sphere or in the course of its star. It is from the specific Divine Aspect (الوجه الخاص الإلهي) that is outside the customary path in natural science, which requires the relative arrangement established by the specific order. This is a subtle issue to grasp. The verifying scholar (العالم المحقق) affirms the cause, for it is necessary, but he does not affirm this specific temporal arrangement in the causes. The general populace of this science either negate the whole or affirm the whole. I have not seen among them one who affirms the persistence of the cause while negating its temporal arrangement. It is a precious knowledge learned from this heaven. What occurs through a cause over a long period may occur through that same cause in the blink of an eye, or even sooner. This appeared in what was narrated concerning the formation of Jesus, peace be upon him, and the formation of Jesus's bird, and the revival of the dead from his grave before the earth experiences labor in bringing forth these generated things on the Day of Resurrection, which is the day of their birth. So, pay attention and sharpen your heart, perhaps your Lord will guide you to the straight path. From this heaven is His saying concerning the rising of the night: <<إِنَّهَا أَقْوَمُ قِيلًا>> (Indeed, it is more suitable for speech). When the follower attained these sciences, the Scribe turned to his guest and directed his attention to him. He gave him from the knowledge deposited in his course what his preparedness granted him concerning his rule over the bodies beneath him in the elemental world, but not concerning their spirits. When he was perfected, that was his hospitality, and he sought departure from it. He came to his companion, the follower, and they departed seeking the Third Heaven. The independent seeker was before the follower like a servant before his master. He had recognized his worth and the rank of his teacher, and the care granted to him by following that Teacher. When they knocked on the Third Heaven, it was opened, and they ascended into it. The follower was received by Joseph (يوسف), peace be upon him, and the independent seeker was received by the planet Venus (كوكب الزهرة). It seated him and mentioned to him what the preceding subjugated stars had mentioned, which increased his distress upon his distress. Then Venus came to Joseph, peace be upon him, and his guest, the follower, was with him, and he was engaging him in familiar conversation. Venus was astonished by his familiarity. He asked about it. Joseph said, "This is the Heaven of Awe, Fear, Severity, and Might (الهيبة والخوف والشدة والبأس). These are attributes that necessitate contraction (القبض). This guest arrived from the followers of the Messenger, and honoring him is obligatory. He arrived seeking Knowledge [علما] and requesting a Divine ruling (حكما إلهيا) to assist him against the enemies of his thoughts, fearing transgression of the limits set by his Lord in what He prescribed for him. So, I unveiled its countenance to him and engaged him in familiar conversation so that his acceptance of what he sought would be upon the expansion of the soul (بسط نفس) with the Holy Spirit (روح قدس)." Then he turned his face to him and said, "This is the Heaven of the Vicegerency of Man [خلافة البشر]. The rule of its Imam (Pharaoh) was weakened, though its origin was the strongest of structures. He was commanded to be gentle with the tyrannical oppressors, and it was said to us: <<فَقُولَا لَهُ قَوْلًا لَيِّنًا>> (Speak to him a gentle word). No one is commanded to speak gently unless his power is greater than the power of the one sent to him, and his might is stronger. But when The Real [الحق] knew that every heart manifesting arrogance and pride was stamped, and that he was in himself the most abject of the abject, He commanded them to treat him with mercy and gentleness, in accordance with his inner state, and to draw out his outer state from his arrogance and pride: <<لَعَلَّهُ يَتَذَكَّرُ أَوْ يَخْشَى>> (Perhaps he may remember or fear). *La'alla* (perhaps) and *asā* (maybe) from Allah are obligatory. So, he remembers, by the gentleness and humility that confronts him, what he is upon in his inner self, so that the outer and inner may be equal. That leaven (الخميرة) continued to work within him, along with the obligatory Divine hope (الترجي الإلهي) that the hoped-for would occur, and its ruling strengthened until the moment his despair of following was cut off, and the state of drowning intervened between him and his ambitions. He resorted to what was hidden in his inner self of abasement and need, so that the occurrence of the Divine hope might be verified among the believers. He said: <<آمَنْتُ بِالَّذِي آمَنَتْ بِهِ بَنُو إِسْرَائِيلَ وَأَنَا مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ>> (I believe in the One in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims). He manifested the state of his inner self and the sound Knowledge [العلم الصحيح] of Allah that was in his heart. He used the phrase <<الَّذِي آمَنَتْ بِهِ بَنُو إِسْرَائِيلَ>> (in Whom the Children of Israel believe) to remove ambiguity when ambiguity arose, just as the sorcerers, when they believed, said: <<آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ * رَبِّ مُوسَى وَهَارُونَ>> (We believe in the Lord of the worlds, the Lord of Moses and Aaron)—meaning the One to Whom they call. They used that to remove doubt. And his saying: <<وَأَنَا مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ>> (And I am of the Muslims) is an address from him to The Real [الحق], knowing that He, the Exalted, hears and sees him. The Real addressed him with the language of reproach and made him hear: <<آلْآنَ>> (Now?) did you manifest what you already knew, <<وَقَدْ عَصَيْتَ قَبْلُ وَكُنْتَ مِنَ الْمُفْسِدِينَ>> (while you disobeyed before and were among the corrupters) in your following? He did not say to him, "And you are among the corrupters." It is a word of good tidings for him, by which He made us know to hope for His Mercy despite our extravagance and crimes. Then He said: <<فَالْيَوْمَ نُنَجِّيكَ>> (So today We will save you). He gave him good tidings before his soul was seized: <<بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكُونَ لِمَنْ خَلْفَكَ آيَةً>> (with your body, that you may be a sign for those who succeed you)—meaning that the salvation for those who come after you will be a sign (علامة) if they say what you said, salvation will be theirs just as it was yours. The verse does not imply that the punishment of the Hereafter is not lifted, nor that his faith was not accepted. Rather, the verse implies that the punishment of this world is not lifted from one upon whom it descends if he believes at the moment of seeing it, <<إِلَّا قَوْمَ يُونُسَ>> (except the people of Jonah). So, His saying: <<فَالْيَوْمَ نُنَجِّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ>> (So today We will save you with your body) means that the punishment only relates to your outer self. He showed creation his salvation from the punishment. The beginning of the drowning was a punishment, but the death within it became a pure, innocent martyrdom, untainted by disobedience. He was seized upon the best of deeds, which is the utterance of faith. All this is so that no one despairs of the Mercy of Allah, and deeds are judged by their conclusions. Faith in Allah had always circulated in his inner self, and the intrinsic Divine stamp (الطابع الإلهي الذاتي) in creation intervened between arrogance and the human subtleties, so arrogance never entered them. As for His saying: <<فَلَمْ يَكُ يَنْفَعُهُمْ إِيمَانُهُمْ لَمَّا رَأَوْا بَأْسَنَا>> (Their faith was of no use to them when they saw Our punishment), this is the speech of a verifier, extremely clear. For the Benefactor is Allah. Only Allah benefited them. And His saying: <<سُنَّتَ اللَّهِ الَّتِي قَدْ خَلَتْ فِي عِبَادِهِ>> (The way of Allah which has passed concerning His servants) means faith upon seeing the unusual punishment. And He said: <<وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا>> (And to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly). The utmost extent of this faith is that it is unwilling (كرها). The Real [الحق], the Exalted, attributed it to Himself. Unwillingness (الكراهة) is located in the heart, and faith is located in the heart. Allah does not hold the servant accountable for deeds that are difficult for him due to the hardship he finds in them; rather, He multiplies the reward for him therein. As for this station, hardship is far from him; rather, his faith came willingly. He did not live after that, as He said concerning the sea traveler when the sea surged: <<ضَلَّ مَنْ تَدْعُونَ إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ>> (Lost are those you invoke except Him). He saved them. If He had seized them upon their salvation, they would have died monotheists, and salvation had been granted to them. Pharaoh was seized, and his term was not delayed at the moment of his faith, lest he return to his former claim. Then, His saying, the Exalted, in completing this story: <<وَإِنَّ كَثِيرًا مِنَ النَّاسِ عَنْ آيَاتِنَا لَغَافِلُونَ>> (And indeed, many among mankind are heedless of Our signs). He manifested your salvation as a sign (آية)—meaning a mark of the attainment of salvation. But most people were heedless of this sign and judged the believer to be wretched. As for His saying: <<فَأَوْرَدَهُمُ النَّارَ>> (Then He led them to the Fire), there is no text that he enters it with them. Rather, Allah said: <<أَدْخِلُوا آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ>> (Admit the people of Pharaoh), and He did not say, "Admit Pharaoh and his people." The Mercy of Allah is wider than the notion that the faith of the distressed is not accepted. What distress is greater than the distress of Pharaoh in the state of drowning? And Allah says: <<أَمَّنْ يُجِيبُ الْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ السُّوءَ>> (Or who answers the distressed one when he calls upon Him and removes the evil?). He coupled answering and the removal of evil for the distressed one when he calls upon Him. This one believed in Allah sincerely. He did not call upon Him to remain in the life of this world out of fear of accidents or that something might intervene between him and this sincerity that came to him in this state. He preferred meeting Allah over remaining by uttering faith. He made that drowning <<نَكَالَ الْآخِرَةِ وَالْأُولَى>> (an exemplary punishment for the Hereafter and the former life). His punishment was no more than the distress of the bitter water, and he was seized upon the best state. This is what the apparent meaning of the word grants. This is the meaning of His saying: <<إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَى>> (Indeed, in that is a lesson for whoever fears)—meaning in his receiving the exemplary punishment of the Hereafter and the former life. He mentioned the Hereafter first and delayed the former life to make known that that punishment, meaning the punishment of drowning, is the exemplary punishment of the Hereafter. Therefore, He mentioned it first before the former life. This is the great favor.

[The Effect of Gentle Speech in Matters]

So look, O follower, at the effect of gentle speech and how it bore this fruit. Therefore, O follower, be gentle in matters, for rebellious souls are led by persuasion. Then he commanded him to be gentle with his companion, the independent seeker. The reason for this command from Aaron (هارون) was that he attained this through direct experience (ذوق) from his own soul when Moses seized him by the head, <<يَجُرُّهُ إِلَيْهِ>> (dragging him toward him). He made him taste humiliation by seizing the beard and the forelock. Aaron called out to him with the most compassionate of parental addresses, saying: <<يَا بْنَ أُمَّ لَا تَأْخُذْ بِلِحْيَتِي وَلَا بِرَأْسِي وَلَا تُشْمِتْ بِيَ الْأَعْدَاءَ>> (O son of my mother, do not seize me by my beard or my head, nor make the enemies rejoice over me), when his brother Moses appeared to him with the attribute of subjugation (القهر). Since Aaron experienced the humiliation of creation through direct experience, despite his innocence of what he was humiliated for, the abasement was doubled for him. He called out to him by kinship (الرحم). This is the reason for his counsel to this follower. Had Moses not cast down the Tablets, he would not have seized his brother by the head, for their text contained Guidance (الهدى) and Mercy (الرحمة), a reminder for Moses. He would have shown mercy to his brother through Mercy and clarified his issue with his people through Guidance. When the anger subsided from him, <<أَخَذَ الْأَلْوَاحَ>> (he took the Tablets). His eye fell only upon the Guidance and Mercy written therein. He said: <<رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِأَخِي وَأَدْخِلْنَا فِي رَحْمَتِكَ وَأَنْتَ أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ>> (My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your Mercy, for You are the Most Merciful of the merciful). Then he commanded him to make what his heaven required—the shedding of blood—into sacrifices and offerings, so that the animal might attain the degree of humanity, since humanity possessed Perfection [الكمال] in the Trust (الأمانة). Then he departed from him with the robe of his host and took his companion by the hand, having benefited him with the knowledge that was within his power concerning what his rule required in the cycle (الدور) and nothing else. They departed seeking the Sixth Heaven. Moses, peace be upon him, received him, accompanied by his minister, Jupiter (البرجيس). The independent seeker did not recognize Moses, peace be upon him, so Jupiter took him and seated him. The follower descended with Moses, who benefited him with twelve thousand sciences of Divine Knowledge [العلم الإلهي], besides what he benefited him with concerning the sciences of the cycle and the era (الكور). He informed him that the Divine Theophany [التجلي الإلهي] only occurs in the forms of beliefs (الاعتقادات) and in needs, so let them be preserved. Then he mentioned Moses's seeking fire for his family, and Theophany only occurred to him within it, since it was the essence of his need. He is only seen in need, and every seeker is necessarily poor toward his sought object. He informed him in this heaven of the stripping of forms from the essence (الجوهر) and the clothing of it with other forms, to teach him that the essences (الأعيان) are the essences of the forms and do not transform, for that would lead to the transformation of realities (انقلاب الحقائق). Rather, perceptions relate to the perceived things, and those perceived things have a reality about which there is no doubt. One who has no Knowledge [علم] of the realities imagines that the essences have transformed, but they have not. From here, one learns of the Theophany [تجلى] of The Real [الحق] on the Day of Resurrection in a form from which the people of the station seek refuge, and they declare The Real transcendent from it, and they seek refuge in Allah from it—yet He is The Real, none other. This is in their sight. For The Real is transcendent from being subject to change and transformation. Alim al-Aswad (The Black Knower) said to a man who stood up and struck a pillar in the Sacred Precinct with his hand, and the man saw it as gold. Then he said to him, "O man, the essences do not transform, but you see it thus according to your reality by your Lord." He was referring to the Theophany of The Real on the Day of Resurrection and His transformation in the eye of the beholder. From this heaven is learned the strange Knowledge [العلم الغريب] that few people know, let alone the many. This is the meaning of the saying of the Exalted to Moses, peace be upon him—and no one knew what Allah intended except Moses and those whom Allah specialized—<<وَمَا تِلْكَ بِيَمِينِكَ يَا مُوسَى>> (And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?). He said: <<هِيَ عَصَايَ>> (It is my staff). A question about necessary things does not come from the Knower of that except for a subtle meaning. Then, in verification of its being a staff, he said: <<أَتَوَكَّأُ عَلَيْهَا وَأَهُشُّ بِهَا عَلَى غَنَمِي وَلِيَ فِيهَا مَآرِبُ أُخْرَى>> (I lean upon it, and I strike down leaves with it for my sheep, and I have other uses for it). All of this is due to its being a staff. Do you see that he informed The Real, the Exalted, of what was not known to The Real? This is an answer of necessary knowledge to a question about a necessarily perceived known thing. He said to him: <<أَلْقِهَا>> (Cast it down)—meaning from your hand, despite your verification that it is a staff. <<فَأَلْقَاهَا مُوسَى فَإِذَا هِيَ>> (So Moses cast it down, and behold, it was)—meaning that staff—<<حَيَّةٌ تَسْعَى>> (a serpent moving swiftly). When Allah clothed the staff—meaning its essence—with the form of the serpent, the ruling of the serpent necessitated it, which is swift movement, so that it might be clear to Moses, peace be upon him, by its movement that it was a serpent. Had it not been for his fear of it—the fear of man from serpents—we would have said that Allah created life in the staff, so it became a serpent due to its life, and it moved swiftly on its belly, since it had no legs to move with. Its form, due to its shape, was the form of serpents. When he feared it because of the form, The Real said to him: <<خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ>> (Take it and do not fear). This is the fear of suddenness, since it was there. Then He said to him: <<سَنُعِيدُهَا>> (We will restore it)—the pronoun refers to the staff—<<سِيرَتَهَا الْأُولَى>> (to its former state). The essences (جواهر) of things are similar, differing by forms and accidents, but the essence is one. Meaning, it returns to being a staff, just as it was in its essence and in your sight, just as it was a serpent in its essence and in your sight, so that Moses might know who sees, what he sees, and by whom he sees. This is a Divine warning to him and to us, and it is what Alim said exactly: that the essences do not transform. The staff does not become a serpent, nor the serpent a staff. But the essence (الجوهر) receptive to the form of the staff accepted the form of the serpent. They are forms that The Real, the Capable, the Creator, strips from the essence when He wills, and clothes it with another form. If you are astute, I have alerted you to the knowledge of what you see of the forms of existents, and you say it is necessary because you cannot deny it. It has become clear to you that transformations (الاستحالات) are impossible. Allah has eyes in some of His servants by which they perceive the staff as a serpent while it is still a staff. This is a Divine perception, and in us, it is imaginative (خيالي). And so it is with all existents equally. Look, were it not for the power of sense, you would not say, "This is an inanimate object that neither senses nor speaks, and it has no life," and "This is a plant," and "This is an animal that senses and perceives," and "This is a human who reasons." All this is granted by your contemplation. Another person comes and stands with you, and he sees and hears the inanimate objects, plants, and animals greeting him. Both matters are sound. And by the power by which you argue for the denial of what the other said, by that very same power, the other argues. The evidence of each person is the very evidence of the other, yet the ruling differs. By Allah, Moses's staff never ceased being a serpent, nor did it cease being a staff. All this is in the matter itself. The vision of neither one missed what the matter is in itself. We have seen and verified this with the sight of the eye. <<هُوَ الْأَوَّلُ وَالْآخِرُ>> (He is the First and the Last) from a single essence. He is in the First Theophany, none other. He is in the Last Theophany, none other. Say God, say world, say I, say you, say He. All are in the Presence of Pronouns (حضرة الضمائر); He has not departed nor ceased. Zayd says "He" concerning you, and Amr says "You" concerning you, and you say "I" concerning yourself. "I" is the essence of "You" and the essence of "He." And "He" is not the essence of "You" nor the essence of "I." The relations differed. Here are vast, deep seas with no bottom and no shore. By the might of my Lord, if you knew what I have uttered in these fragments, you would rejoice with eternal joy, and you would fear a fear with which no one finds security. The mountain crumbled by the very essence of its stability, and Moses's recovery was the very essence of his swoon.

Look at His Face in every event / Of existence, and do not inform anyone of it.

O Muhammadan follower, do not be heedless of what I have alerted you to, and do not cease looking at Him in every form. For the Manifestor is the most manifest.
Then Jupiter took his hand and brought him to the independent seeker. He informed him of some things appropriate to him from the knowledge Moses taught the follower, specifically concerning the effects of the celestial movements on the elemental constitutions, and nothing else. They departed from him: the Muhammadan follower upon the carpet of Divine Care [رفرف العناية], and the independent seeker upon the steed of Contemplation (براق الفكر). The Seventh Heaven was opened for them—which is the First in reality from that perspective. Abraham the Intimate (إبراهيم الخليل), peace be upon him, received the follower, and the independent seeker was received by the planet Saturn (كوكب كيوان). It seated him in a dark, desolate, lonely house and said to him, "This is the house of your brother"—meaning itself—"Stay here until I come to you, for I am in the service of this Muhammadan follower because of the one upon whom he descended, who is the Intimate of Allah." He came to him and found him leaning his back against the Frequented House (البيت المعمور), and the follower was sitting before him like a son before his father. Abraham was saying to him, "What an excellent, dutiful son!" The follower asked him about the three lights (the stars he used as proof). He said, "They were my proof against my people, granted to me by Allah as an act of care toward me. I did not say them out of arrogance, but I made them a hunter's snare by which I catch the straying intellects of my people." Then he said to him, "O follower, distinguish the ranks, know the doctrines, and be upon clear evidence from your Lord in your affair. Do not neglect your discourse, for you are neither neglected nor left aimlessly. Make your heart like this Frequented House [البيت المعمور] by your presence with The Real [الحق] in every state."

[Nothing of what you have seen encompasses The Real except the heart of the believer]

Know that nothing of what you have seen encompasses The Real (الحق) except the heart of the believer, and that is you. When the Speculative Thinker (صاحب النظر) heard this address, he said: <<O my sorrow for what I neglected in relation to Allah, and indeed I was among the mockers!>> He knew what he had missed of faith in that Messenger and following his Sunnah, and he said: O would that I had not taken my intellect as a guide, nor followed the path of speculation (الفكر) with it.

Each one of these two persons perceives what the higher spiritual realities (الروحانيات العلى) bestow and what the Highest Assembly (الملأ الأعلى) glorifies, due to the purity they possess and the liberation of the soul from the captivity of nature (الطبيعة). Everything in the World (العالم) was inscribed upon the essence of the soul of each of them, so he only reports what he witnessed of himself in the mirror of his own essence (ذاته).

This is like the story of the Sage (الحكيم) who wished to show this station to the King. The master of beautiful painting busied himself with engraving images in the most marvelous order and with the finest perfection, while the Sage busied himself with polishing the wall opposite the place of the images, with a hanging, drawn curtain between them. When each finished his work and perfected his craft in what he intended, the King came and stood before what the painter had depicted. He saw marvelous images whose beautiful arrangement and wondrous engraving astonished the minds. He looked at those colors in the beauty of that craftsmanship and saw something whose sight terrified him. He looked at what the other had done—the polishing of that surface—and saw nothing. The Sage said to him: O King, my craft is subtler than his craft, and my wisdom is more profound than his wisdom. Lift the curtain between us and him so that you may see my work and his work in a single state. So the curtain was lifted, and everything the other had painted was inscribed upon that polished surface in a form subtler than its original state. The King was astonished. Then the King saw his own image and the image of the Polisher in that surface, and he was bewildered and amazed, saying: How can this be? He replied: O King, I have set this as an example for your soul in relation to the forms of the World (العالم). If you polish the mirror of your soul through spiritual disciplines (الرياضات) and striving (المجاهدات) until it is purified, and you remove the rust of nature (الطبيعة) from it, and you face the forms of the World with the mirror of your essence (ذاتك), everything in the entire World will be inscribed upon it.

The Speculative Thinker (صاحب النظر) and the Followers of the Messengers (أتباع الرسل) reach this limit, and this is the Presence (الحضرة) that unites them. The Follower (التابع) surpasses the Speculative Thinker in matters that were not inscribed in the World as a whole, specifically concerning that particular Face (الوجه الخاص) which belongs to Allah in every originated contingent being (ممكن محدث)—a Face that is neither confined, regulated, nor imaginable—by which this Follower is distinguished from the Speculative Thinker.

From this heaven comes the gradual enticement (الاستدراج) that is unknown, the hidden cunning (المكر الخفي) that is not perceived, the firm plotting (الكيد المتين), the veil (الحجاب), steadfastness in affairs, and deliberation in them. From here, the meaning of His saying is known: <<The creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind>> because they hold the degree of fatherhood over mankind, and mankind can never catch up to them. The Exalted said: <<Give thanks to Me and to your parents.>> From this heaven, it is known that everything other than humans (الإنس) and jinn (الجان) is blessed and will not enter into eternal wretchedness (الشقاء الأخروي). As for humans and jinn, some are wretched and some are blessed. The wretched proceed to a term among the wretched because Mercy preceded Wrath, and the blessed proceed without a term. From here, the preference given to the creation of man and the turning of the two Hands towards the creation of Adam, unlike other creatures, is known.

### There is no genus of creatures except that it has one method of creation (ما من جنس من مخلوقات إلا وله طريقة واحدة في الخلق)

It is known that there is no genus of creatures except that it has one method of creation; the types of creation did not vary for it as they varied for man. For man, creation varied: the creation of Adam differs from the creation of Eve, the creation of Eve differs from the creation of Jesus, and the creation of Jesus differs from the creation of the rest of the children of Adam, yet all of them are human. From here, the evil of his deeds is made fair-seeming (زين) to man, so he sees it as good. When this beautification (التزيين) manifests, the Follower (التابع) thanks Allah the Exalted for being saved from such a thing. But the Speculative Thinker (صاحب النظر) finds no relief except in this Theophany (التجلي), which grants him beauty in evil, and this is part of the Divine Cunning (المكر الإلهي).

From here, the essences of forms (أعيان الصور) are established in the substance (الجوهر) that is specifically beneath this sphere down to the Earth. From here, the religion of Abraham (ملة إبراهيم) is known to be a tolerant religion (ملة سمحاء) in which there is no hardship. When the Speculative Thinker knew these meanings and understood the fatherhood of Islam, he desired proximity to him. Abraham said to the Follower: Who is this stranger with you? He replied: He is my brother. Abraham asked: Is he your brother by suckling or your brother by lineage? He said: My brother by water. Abraham said: You speak the truth, that is why I do not know him. Do not accompany anyone except one who is your brother by suckling, just as I am your father by suckling, for the Presence of Felicity (الحضرة السعادية) accepts only brothers and sisters by suckling, and their fathers and mothers, for they are the beneficial ones in the sight of Allah. Do you not see that Knowledge (العلم) appears in the form of milk in the Presence of Imagination (حضرة الخيال)? This is due to suckling. The back of the Speculative Thinker was broken when his lineage to his father Abraham, peace be upon him, was severed.

Then he commanded him to enter the Frequented House (البيت المعمور). He entered it without his companion, whose head was bowed. Then he exited through the door he entered and did not exit through the Door of the Angels, which is the second door, due to a specific property: whoever exits through it does not return to it. Then he departed from him, seeking the ascent (العروج). His companion, the Speculative Thinker, was detained there, and it was said to him: Stop until your companion returns, for you have no footing here. This is the end of the smoke. He said: I submit (أسلم) and enter under the ruling that my companion entered. It was said to him: This is not the place for accepting Islam. When you return to your homeland from which you and your companion came, then if you submit, believe, and follow the path of those who turn to Allah with the turning of the Messengers who convey from Allah, you will be accepted just as your companion was accepted. So he remained there, and the Follower proceeded.

He reached the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary (سدرة المنتهى). He saw the forms of the deeds of the blessed, including the Prophets and the Followers of the Messengers, and he saw his own deed among their deeds. He thanked Allah for guiding him to follow the teaching Messenger. There he witnessed four rivers: one great, mighty river, and small streams branching off from that great river. And from that great river, the three major rivers burst forth. The Follower asked about those rivers and streams, and it was said to him: This is a parable set up for you. This greatest river is the Quran. These three rivers are the three Books: the Torah, the Psalms, and the Gospel. And these streams are the Scrolls revealed to the Prophets. Whoever drinks from any river or stream is an heir to the one who drank from it. Every truth is the Word of Allah, and the scholars are the inheritors of the Prophets by virtue of what they drank from these rivers and streams. So, enter the River of the Quran, and you will succeed in every path to felicity, for it is the river of Muhammad (may Allah bless him and grant him peace), whose prophethood was confirmed while Adam was between water and clay, and who was given the comprehensive words (جوامع الكلم), was sent universally, and by whom the branches of rulings were abrogated, while none of his rulings were abrogated by another.

He looked at the beauty of the Light that covered that Lote Tree and saw that it was covered by that which covered it, so no one could describe it due to the luminous covering (الغشاء النوري) that eyes cannot penetrate; rather, <<Vision comprehends Him not.>> Then it was said to him: This is the Tree of Purification, in it is the pleasure of The Real (الحق). From here, the use of the Lote leaves (السدر) in washing the dead for the meeting with Allah was legislated—water and Lote leaves, softening it, are the purification of this Lote Tree. To it ascend the felicitous deeds of the children of Adam, and in it are their stores until the Day of Judgment. Here is the first footing of the blessed. The Seventh Heaven, where your companion stopped, is the end of the smoke, and it, and all that is beneath it, must necessarily transform into forms they were upon, or similar forms, before they became heaven.

Then it was said to this Follower: Ascend. So he ascended into the Sphere of the Lunar Mansions (فلك المنازل). There he was met by angels and planetary spirits (الأرواح الكوكبية) inhabiting more than a thousand and tens of Presences (الحضرات). He witnessed the stations (منازل) of those journeying to Allah the Exalted through prescribed deeds. Al-Harawi mentioned some of this in a section he named *Manazil al-Sa'irin* (Stations of the Seekers), which contains one hundred stations (مقام), each containing ten stations, which are the mansions (منازل). As for us, we mentioned these mansions in a book we named *Manahij al-Irtiqa'* (Methods of Ascent), which contains three hundred stations, each containing ten mansions, totaling three thousand mansions. He continued to traverse them, mansion by mansion, based on the seven realities (حقائق) he possessed, just as the seven wandering stars traverse them, but in a shorter time, until he grasped all their realities. Idris had advised him of this.

When he witnessed each mansion, he saw it and all the stars within it traversing another sphere above it. He sought to ascend into it to see the signs and wonders that Allah had deposited in these matters, indicating His Power and Knowledge. When he reached its surface, he arrived in the Dark Green Paradise (الجنة الدهماء). He saw what Allah described in His Book concerning the description of the Gardens, and he witnessed their degrees, their chambers, and what Allah prepared for their inhabitants. He saw his own specific Garden, and he observed the Gardens of Inheritance, the Gardens of Specialization, and the Gardens of Deeds. He tasted of every delight therein according to the taste bestowed by the locus of the paradisiacal power.

When he achieved his desire from that, he was raised to the Most Radiant Level (المستوي الأزهى) and the Most Splendid Veil (الستر الأبهى). He saw the forms of Adam and his blessed children behind those veils. He understood their meaning, the wisdom Allah deposited in them, and the robes of honor (الخلع) with which He clothed the children of Adam. Those forms greeted him, and he saw his own form among them. He embraced it, and it embraced him, and it rushed with him to the station of proximity (المكانة الزلفى). He entered the Sphere of the Constellations (فلك البروج), concerning which Allah swore: <<By the heaven containing the constellations.>>

He knew that the formations (التكوينات) that occur in the Gardens (الجنان) result from the movement of this sphere, which has the daily movement in the temporal world, just as the movement of night and day is in the sphere containing the body of the sun. And the formations that occur in Hell (جهنم) result from the movement of the Sphere of the Stars (فلك الكواكب), which is the roof of Hell—meaning its concave side—and its surface is the ground of Paradise. And that which falls from the stars and whose light is scattered, remaining dark while the action deposited within them remains—all of this is the cause of the replacement that occurs in Hell: <<Every time their skins are roasted through, We will replace them with other skins.>> All of that is by the permission of Allah, Who arranges things according to their Levels (مراتب). Just as when the sun enters Aries, the time of spring comes, and the adornment of the earth appears, and the trees sprout leaves and are adorned, and <<cause to grow [something] of every beautiful pair.>> And when it enters Capricorn, it manifests the opposite. The recipients (القوابل) accept according to their temperament (المزاج). Whenever their temperament differs, their acceptance of what Allah creates during these celestial movements is according to their state.

Likewise, in the Gardens, there is new creation and new delight at every moment so that boredom does not occur. For everything natural, if a matter continues upon it without change, boredom must necessarily accompany man, for boredom is an essential characteristic (نعت ذاتي) of him. If Allah did not nourish him with renewal at every moment so that the delight might endure for him thereby, boredom would overtake them. Thus, the people of the Gardens perceive in every glance they cast upon their dominion a matter and a form they had not seen before, and they are delighted by its occurrence. Likewise, in every meal and drink, they find a new, delicious taste they had not found in the first meal, and they are delighted by that, and their appetite increases.

The reason for the speed of this change and its permanence is that the Origin (الأصل) is based on that, so it gives in the cosmos (الكون) according to what the reality of its Level (مرتبته) bestows, so that He is continuously Creative (خلاقا على الدوام) and the cosmos is continuously poor/needy (فقيرا على الدوام). Therefore, all Existence (الوجود) is continuously in motion, both in this world and the Hereafter, because formation (التكوين) does not arise from stillness. From Allah come permanent orientations (توجهات دائمة) and inexhaustible Words, which is His saying: <<And what is with Allah remains.>> The orientation (التوجه) is with Allah, which is His saying: <<When We intend it,>> and the Word of the Presence (كلمة الحضرة) is His saying to everything He wills: "Be!" (كُنْ), in the meaning befitting His Majesty. And "Be!" is a letter of existence (حرف وجودي), so nothing comes from it but Existence (الوجود); non-existence (عدم) does not come from it, because the cosmos (الكون) is Existence.

These orientations and Words are in the Treasuries of Generosity (خزائن الجود) for everything that accepts Existence. The Exalted said: <<And there is nothing except that with Us are its treasuries,>> which is what we mentioned, and His saying: <<And We do not send it down except in a known measure,>> from His Name, The Wise (الحكيم). Wisdom (الحكمة) is the sovereign of this Divine sending down (الإنزال الإلهي), which is the bringing forth of these things from these Treasuries into the existence of their Fixed Entities (أعيانها). This is our saying in the opening sermon of this book: Praise be to Allah, Who brought things into existence from non-existence, and its non-existence, and the non-existence of non-existence is Existence (وجود). It is the relationship of things being preserved in these Treasuries, existing for Allah, established for their Fixed Entities (أعيانها), but not existing for themselves. By looking at their Fixed Entities, they exist from non-existence. By looking at their being with Allah in these Treasuries, they exist from the non-existence of non-existence, which is Existence. If you wish, you may favor the aspect of their being in the Treasuries, and we say: He brought things into existence from their existence in the Treasuries to their existence in their Fixed Entities for the purpose of delighting in them or otherwise. And if you wish, you may say: He brought things into existence from non-existence, after you understand the meaning of what I have mentioned to you. Say what you wish, for He is the One Who brings them into existence in every state, in the locus where they appeared for their Fixed Entities.

As for His saying: <<What is with you will be exhausted,>> this is correct in Knowledge (العلم), because the address here is to the essence of the Substance (عين الجوهر). And what is with it—meaning with the Substance—of every existent thing is only what Allah brings into existence in its place, such as Attributes (الصفات), accidents (الأعراض), and occurrences (الأكوان). These, in the second moment of time or the second state—say what you wish—from the moment of their existence or the state of their existence, cease to exist from us. This is His saying: <<What is with you will be exhausted.>> He continuously renews for the Substance the likes or the opposites from these Treasuries. This is the meaning of the saying of the Theologians (المتكلمين) that the accident (العرض) does not remain for two moments of time. This is a correct statement, a report without doubt, because it is the verified matter upon which the characteristic of contingent beings (الممكنات) rests. And by the renewal of that upon the Substance, its essence (عينه) remains perpetually, as long as Allah wills. And He has willed that it shall not perish, so its subsistence (بقائه) is necessary.

The Follower learns from this Presence the paradisiacal formations and everything we have mentioned. But the Speculative Thinker, the Follower's companion, has no knowledge of any of this, because it is a prophetic warning, not speculative thought (نظر فكري). The Speculative Thinker is constrained under the authority of his thought, and thought has no scope except in its own specific field, which is known among the fields. For every faculty in man has a field in which it operates and which it does not transgress. Whenever a faculty transgresses its field, it falls into error and mistake and is described as deviating from its straight path. Visual Unveiling (الكشف البصري) may witness what rational arguments (الحجج العقلية) stumble over, and the reason for this is their departure from their proper domain. The intellects described as misguided were only misguided by their thoughts, and their thoughts went astray because they operated outside their proper locus. And those thoughts operated outside their proper locus and roamed outside their field only to demonstrate the superiority of some people over others. Superiority appeared in the World (العالم) only so that it might be known that The Real (الحق) has care for some of His servants and abandonment for others, and so that it might be known that the contingent being (الممكن) has not departed from its contingency, and that the determinant factor for it is a specific regard for whomever He wills among these faculties, with whatever He wills, <<And He is the All-Knowing, the All-Powerful.>>

Then the Follower is brought out with his carrier to the Throne (الكرسي). There he sees the division of the Word, which was described as Unity (الوحدة) before reaching this station. He sees the two Feet that hang down to it, and he immediately prostrates to kiss them. One Foot grants the permanence of the people of the Gardens in their Gardens—this is the Foot of Truthfulness (قدم الصدق). The other Foot grants the permanence of the people of Hell in Hell, in whatever state He wills—this is the Foot of Omnipotence (قدم الجبروت). For this reason, He said concerning the people of the Gardens: <<An uninterrupted gift,>> thus He did not describe it as ceasing. And He said concerning the people of Hell: <<Those who were wretched,>> so that this Foot of Omnipotence might rule: <<Indeed, your Lord is the Doer of what He intends.>> He did not say that the state they are in will not cease, as He said concerning the blessed. What prevented that is His saying: <<And My Mercy encompasses all things,>> and His saying: "My Mercy preceded My Wrath" in this existence (النشأة). For Existence (الوجود) is Mercy in relation to every existent thing, even if some of them are tormented by others. Thus, their eternity in the state of delight is uninterrupted, but their eternity in the state of vengeance (الانتقام) is dependent on Will. Vengeance may revert to being merely torment (عذابا) for them, and the vengeance itself ceases. For this reason, He explained it in some places as painful suffering, saying: *‘Adhabun Alim* (painful torment) and *Al-‘Adhab al-Alim* (the painful torment). In other places, He did not qualify the torment as painful but left it absolute, saying: <<The torment will not be lightened for them,>> meaning even if the pain ceases. He spoke of the torment of Hell (جهنم) without describing it as painful, saying: <<It will not be abated for them>> in its being torment, <<and they therein>>—meaning in the torment—<<are in despair (مُبْلِسُونَ)>>—meaning distanced from accidental felicity (السعادة العرضية) in this locus, because *Iblas* (الإبلاس) is a term specific to the people of Hell regarding their distance. Therefore, He mentioned *Iblas* to place this linguistic term in its proper context among its people so they may know it, for the locus of Hell has a language that the people of the Gardens do not have, and *Iblas* is part of it.

The Follower learns from this station what belongs to each abode. Then he leaves this place and is plunged into the Greatest Light (النور الأعظم), and ecstasy (الوجد) overcomes him. This Light is the Presence of Spiritual States (حضرة الأحوال) whose ruling appears in human individuals. This appears most often upon them during the audition of melodies (سماع الألحان). When these melodies descend upon them, they pass through the spheres, and the movements of the spheres have pleasant, delightful tunes that the ears enjoy, like the sounds of the waterwheel. These clothe the spiritual states and descend with them upon the animal souls in the gatherings of audition. If the soul is attached to anything—whether a maiden or a youth—or if he is one of the People of Allah (أهل الله), his attachment is the love of Divine Beauty (جمال الإلهي), imagined, which they acquired from prophetic phrases, such as His saying in the *Sahih*: "Indeed, Allah is Beautiful and loves beauty," and His saying in the purification: "Worship Allah as if you see Him." Then ecstasy seizes him based on what he imagined. Among them are those whom the spiritual state (الحال) overwhelms, not from the Presence of Imagination (حضرة التخيل), but they find a matter that cannot be qualified or contained by limitation and measure. Among them are those upon whom the fragrances of these states that bestow ecstasy blow, upon souls that are not lovers except partially, not totally. This grants them a ruling for that, a meaning called induced ecstasy (التواجد).

Then he emerges from that Light to the locus of Universal Mercy (الرحمة العامة) that encompasses all things, which is expressed as the Throne (العرش). There he finds, among the Angelic Realities (الحقائق الملكية): Israfil, Gabriel, Michael, Ridwan, and Malik; and among the Human Angelic Realities (الحقائق الملكية البشرية): Adam, Abraham, and Muhammad, peace of Allah be upon them. He finds with Adam and Israfil the Knowledge (علم) of the manifest forms in the World (العالم), called bodies (أجسام), physical bodies (أجساد), and structures (هياكل), whether luminous or non-luminous. He finds with Gabriel and Muhammad, peace be upon them, the Knowledge of the Spirits (الأرواح) breathed into these forms that are with Adam and Israfil. He grasps the meanings of all that and sees the relationship of these Spirits to these forms, their governance over them, and whence the differentiation occurred among them despite their emanation from a single origin. Likewise, the forms learned all of that from this Presence. From this Presence, he learns the Knowledge of the Elixirs (الأكاسير) that transform the forms of physical bodies (الأجساد) by virtue of the spirit within them. He looks at Michael and Abraham, peace be upon them, and finds with them the Knowledge of Provisions (الأرزاق) and what nourishes the forms and the spirits, and by what their subsistence (بقاؤها) occurs. He understands that the Elixir is a specific nourishment for that body which it turns into gold or silver after it was iron or copper, which is the health of that body and the removal of the illness that had entered it in its mine, turning it into iron or otherwise. He learns all of this from this Presence. Then he looks at Ridwan and Malik and finds with them the Knowledge of Felicity (السعادة) and Wretchedness (الشقاء), Paradise and its degrees, and Hell and its abysses. This is the Knowledge of the Levels (المراتب) in the Promise and the Threat, and he knows the reality of what each of them bestows.

When he knows all of this, he knows the Throne (العرش), its bearers, and what is under its encompassment, which is the limit of bodies (الأجسام). Beyond it, there is no composite body possessing shape and measure. When he knows all of this, he is ascended in another spiritual ascent (معراج معنوي), not in an imagined form, to the Level of Measures (مرتبة المقادير). From it, he learns the quantities of physical things and their weights in the measured bodies, from the encompassing sphere down to the dust, and what is in them and between them of the types of the World who inhabit these places. Then he moves to the Knowledge of the Total Dark Substance (الجوهر المظلم الكل), which has no part and no form. It is the Unseen (غيب) of everything beyond it in the World. From it appeared these lights and illuminations in the world of bodies (عالم الأجسام). These composite lights were stripped away from this Substance, so it remained dark, just as the day is stripped away from the night, and darkness becomes manifest. This is the origin of darkness in the World and the origin of the World in nomological rulings (الأحكام الناموسية).

Then he moves from this station to the Presence of Simple Nature (حضرة الطبيعة البسيطة). He learns its ruling over bodies absolutely, regardless of the difference in their compositions and states, and whence the error occurred for some natural philosophers (الطبيعيين) in their knowledge of its rulings—this is due to their ignorance of the Knowledge of its Essence (ذاتها). The possessor of this Unveiling (الكشف) knows all of that. Then he moves from contemplating that to witnessing the Preserved Tablet (اللوح المحفوظ), which is the existent emanation from the Pen (القلم). Allah has inscribed upon it whatever He willed of the occurrences (الكوائن) in the World. This Follower learns from what is in this Tablet the Knowledge of the two powers: the Knowledge of Knowing and the Knowledge of Acting, and he learns the emanating passive states (الانفعالات الانبعاثية). From the fact that this Spirit is a Tablet, he learns what was inscribed upon it by the One Who named it a Tablet, by the Divine Pen (القلم الإلهي), dictated to it by The Real (الحق). Its writing upon it is the engraving of the forms of the known things (صور المعلومات) that Allah causes to flow in the World, specifically in this world until the Day of Resurrection. These are confined sciences, inscribed as forms, like the forms of letters inscribed on tablets and books, called Words (كلمات). The number of their matrices is exactly what results from multiplying the degrees of the sphere by itself, without increase or decrease. From here, Allah placed three hundred and sixty degrees in the sphere through which the stars traverse by their swimming, and within this, the year in the lower abode is confined by the swimming of the sun and the moon. The Exalted said: <<The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation.>> This repeats through the years from the beginning of its existence—though it is not truly repetition—until it reaches the amount resulting from multiplying three hundred and sixty by the number of years, which is the lifespan of the world of this life. Then He dictates another matter and sciences specific to the Resurrection and the Scales, also until a specified term, with a distinction in the two abodes, which is the end of the period of vengeance (الانتقام) specifically upon the people of the abode of wretchedness. Then the writing of torment in this abode is resumed, along with eternal permanence in the two abodes for their inhabitants. However, whatever the writing may be, it must necessarily proceed to a specified term, due to the impossibility of the infinite entering into Existence (الوجود).

Then this Follower moves from this station to the witnessing of the Supreme Pen (القلم الأعلى). From this witnessing, he gains the Knowledge of Sainthood (علم الولاية). From there begins the Level of Vicegerency (مرتبة الخلافة) and Representation (النيابة). From there, the registers (الدواوين) were compiled, and the authority of the Name, The Director (المدبر) and The Distinguisher (المفصل), appeared, which is His saying: <<He directs the matter; He details the signs.>> This is the Knowledge of the Pen (علم القلم). He witnesses the subtle spiritual movement of the Right Hand upon it, and whence it draws its supply. He sees that from its own Essence (ذاته), it possesses the Knowledge of the Summary and the Detail, and the detail appears through inscription, which is the very essence of its being. Thus, it has no need for a teacher from whom to draw supply, except its Creator, the Mighty and Majestic. Its writing is engraving, and for this reason, it is permanent and does not accept erasure. By this, the Tablet was named the Preserved (المحفوظ), meaning preserved from erasure. If its writing were like writing with ink, it would accept erasure, just as the Tablet of Erasure (لوح المحو) accepts it in the world of generation (عالم الكون) by the specific Pen that is between the two Fingers of the All-Merciful. From this witnessing, he distinguishes between the Pens, the Tablets, and the types of scribes, and he learns the Knowledge of Rulings (الأحكام) and Perfection (الإحكام). From here, he knows that nothing remains in contingency (الإمكان) that ought to be a proof for Allah except that it has appeared as a proof, and even if the proofs are numerous, they are specifically unified by the perfection of the indication.

Then he looks to the right of this witnessing and sees the World of Bewilderment (عالم الهيمان), which is the World created from the Cloud (العماء). Then he moves to the Cloud (العماء), which is the Level (مستوي) of the Name, The Lord (الرب), just as the Throne (العرش) was the Level of The All-Merciful (الرحمن).

### The Cloud is the first of the Where-nesses (العماء هو أول الأينيات)

The Cloud (العماء) is the first of the Where-nesses (الأينيات). From it appeared the spatial containers (الظروف المكانيات) and the Levels (المراتب) for those who did not accept place but accepted station (المكانة). From it appeared the loci capable of receiving physical meanings, both sensually and imaginatively. It is a noble existent whose meaning is The Real (الحق). It is The Real by which every existent thing other than Allah was created. It is the meaning in which the Fixed Entities (أعيان الممكنات) were established and settled. It accepts the reality of Where-ness (الأين), the containment of place, the rank of station, and the name of locus. From the world of the Earth up to this Cloud, there are none of the Names of Allah except the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال) specifically; nothing else has an effect in the cosmos (كون) between them, whether in the intelligible or sensible world.

However, the companion of the Follower, who is the Speculative Thinker (صاحب النظر), when his companion left him at the Seventh Heaven and departed from him, a subtle trace (رقيقة) extended from him, following a path different from the Follower's ascent. It appeared to the Follower in the Sphere of the Stars, and he lost it in Paradise. Then it appeared to him in the Sphere of the Constellations, and he lost it again in the Throne (الكرسي) and the Arsh (العرش). Then it appeared to him in the Level of Measures (مرتبة المقادير) and in the Dark Substance (الجوهر المظلم). Then he lost it in Nature (الطبيعة). Then it appeared to him in the Soul (النفس) from the perspective of its being a soul, not from the perspective of its being a Tablet. Then it appeared to him in the Creative Intellect (العقل الإبداعي) from the perspective of its being an intellect, not from the perspective of its being a Pen. After that, it departed from him, and he saw no trace of it.

From this Cloud (العماء), he begins the ascent (الترقي) and spiritual journey (المعراج) through the Names of Transcendence (أسماء التنزيه) until he reaches the Presence (الحضرة) where he witnesses that Transcendence limits Him, points to Him, and restricts Him. He overlooks the entire World—the spiritual, the pneumatic, the bodily, and the physical—and finds nothing in that witnessing that ought to be transcended concerning the One Who appeared therein. He sees his connection to Him as the connection of the Level (المرتبة) to its possessor. Thus, the Transcendence (التنزيه) he imagined is not possible for him, nor is Anthropomorphism (التشبيه) possible for him, for there is nothing there:

By whom? For there is nothing there but Allah, nothing else,
And there is nothing there but the Unity of Unities (وحدة الوحدات).

Then he left the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال), and the Names of Transcendence (أسماء التنزيه) took charge of him. He saw his companion, the Speculative Thinker, accompanying him until he reached the Presence (الحضرة) that accepts neither Transcendence nor Anthropomorphism. He transcends limitation by negating Transcendence, and he transcends measure by negating Anthropomorphism. There, he loses his companion, the Speculative Thinker.

Then he turned back, seeking that from which he emerged. The Real (الحق) the Exalted led him along a path other than his first path—a path that cannot be described and is known only by one who witnesses it through direct experience (ذوقا). His companion returned along his ascent, since he was not a Follower, until he reached his body and met his comrade. Immediately, the Speculative Thinker hastened to the Messenger, if he was present, or to his heir, and pledged allegiance to him—the pledge of faith and contentment—<<upon a clear proof from his Lord>> and a sign from his own soul, and <<followed by a witness from Him,>> who is the Follower. So he believed in Allah from the perspective of what was legislated for him concerning belief in Him, not from the perspective of his rational proof. He found with him and in his heart a Light (نورا) he had not found before. In a single glance, while he was in his place, he saw with that Light everything the Follower had seen in his first ascent. He did not stop but ascended the ascent of the Follower until he reached the Cloud (العماء) and the ultimate limit. He saw the thing in things, and he saw the necessary existence of that whose existence his thought and intellect had deemed impossible. He did not move from his place. He was given the Elixir of Formation (إكسير التكوين), and he saw the gathering of bodies from stage to stage, due to the difference in ruling and the difference in cycle, so the forms changed and the states transformed. He saw what we said concerning that, such as:

<<When the heaven is split apart,>>
A reality that was formed.
Who is for her, by her, for her?
<<When the stars fall, losing their luster.>>
Seeking by their falling,
<<Mountains of rock are moved.>>
Looking at their movement,
<<Hellfire is set ablaze.>>
Its blazing is its kindling,
<<And Paradise is brought near.>>
A group enters it,
From their graves, they have been scattered.
I said to her: What do you seek?
She said: Wild beasts have been gathered.
And that my soul may see
What it has sent forth and held back.

When the Speculative Thinker submitted and believed, and saw from his station everything the Follower had seen in his ascent through direct witnessing, he asked to see the station of the criminals (المجرمين), who are those deserving of that abode which they entered by the ruling of desert. They knew that Knowledge (العلم) is the noblest garment and ignorance (الجهل) is the ugliest adornment, and that Hell is not an abode for anything good, just as Paradise is not an abode for anything evil. He saw Faith (الايمان) established in the heart of one who had no Knowledge (علم) of what is due to Allah’s Majesty, and he saw Knowledge of Allah’s Majesty and what is due to Him established in one who possessed nothing of Faith. This knowledgeable person, due to the absence of Faith, deserved the abode of wretchedness (دار الشقاء), while the ignorant believer deserved, by Faith, the abode of felicity (دار السعادة) and high degrees (الدرجات) in contrast to the abysses (الدركات). So, the knowledgeable person who deserved the abode of wretchedness was stripped of his Knowledge (علمه) until it was as if he had never known it or known anything, and he is tormented by his ignorance more severely than by his physical torment, which is the most severe upon him. His Knowledge was bestowed upon this ignorant believer who entered Paradise by his Faith. The believer thereby attained, through that Knowledge stripped from the one who deserved residence in the abode of wretchedness, the degree sought by that Knowledge, and he delights in it, spiritually and physically, and on the Dune at the time of the Vision. That disbeliever is given the ignorance of this ignorant believer, and by that ignorance, he attains that abyss of the Fire. That is the most intense sorrow (حسرة) that passes over him, for he remembers the Knowledge he possessed but does not know it now, and he knows that it was stripped from him. Allah unveils his sight so that he sees the Level (مرتبة) of the Knowledge he possessed in the Gardens and sees the garment of his Knowledge upon another who did not strive to acquire it. He seeks some of it within himself but cannot find it. This believer looks and observes the midst of Hell (سواء الجحيم) and sees the evil of his ignorance upon that knowledgeable person who was not a believer, and his delight and joy increase. How great is that sorrow!

Something astonishing happened to me concerning this matter. One of the philosophers (الفلاسفة) heard this discourse from me and perhaps deemed it impossible in his soul or belittled my intellect concerning it. So Allah informed him through an Unveiling (كشف) about which he had no doubt in his soul, such that the matter was verified exactly as we stated. He came to me weeping over himself and his negligence. I had a companionship with him, and he mentioned the matter to me, repented, recovered what he had missed, and believed. He said to me: I have never seen a sorrow more intense than that. And the saying of the Exalted was verified: <<Indeed, I advise you lest you be among the ignorant,>> and His saying: <<So do not be among the ignorant.>> The first combined an address of kindness and gentleness, and the second, harshness and severity, because the first was an elder, so He addressed him with gentleness, and the second was a youth, so He addressed him with severity. May Allah benefit us with Knowledge (العلم) and make us among its people, and may He not make us among those whose good deeds strive for the sake of others while they themselves are wretched. Amen, by His Might. End of the One Hundred and Eighth Part.

In the Name of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful.

(باب ایک سو سڑسٹھ: کیمیائے سعادت (کیمیاے سعادت) کی معرفت میں)

> بے شک اکسیریں ایک دلیل ہیں جو اس بات پر دلالت کرتی ہیں کہ ہستی (الوجود) میں کیا تبدیلی اور تغیر ہے۔
> بے شک دشمن عنایت کے اکسیر سے، جب وہ ایک مقررہ میزان پر ڈالا جاتا ہے،
> تو اسی وقت وہ اپنی عداوت سے سچائی کے ساتھ، حکم اور تقدیر کے ذریعے، اپنی ولایت کی طرف نکل آتا ہے۔
> پس وزن کو درست کرو، کیونکہ میزان ہماری شریعت ہے، اور میں نے واضح کر دیا ہے، لہٰذا اس میں محتاط رہو۔
> کیمیا مقررہ مقداریں ہیں، کیونکہ عالمِ صُور میں عدد کی کیا مقدار ہے۔
> اگر تم صاحبِ نظر ہو تو اس سے ہوشیار رہو، اور خواہشات تمہیں غور و فکر سے نہ ہٹائیں۔
> تم پاکیزہ فرشتوں کے رتبے سے جا ملو گے، اور عالمِ بشر کے رتبوں سے بلند ہو جاؤ گے۔

### [کیمیا کیا ہے؟]

کیمیا اس علم کا نام ہے جو ہر اس چیز میں مقداروں اور اوزان سے متعلق ہے جس میں مقدار اور وزن داخل ہوتا ہے، خواہ وہ اجسام ہوں یا معانی، محسوس ہوں یا معقول۔ اور اس کا غلبہ تغیرات (الاستحالات) میں ہے، یعنی ایک ہی عین پر حالتوں کا بدل جانا۔ پس یہ ایک طبعی، روحانی، الٰہی علم ہے۔ اور ہم نے اسے الٰہی اس لیے کہا کہ اس میں استواء (استواء)، نزول (نزول)، معیت (معية)، اور ایک ہی مسمیٰ پر الٰہی اسماء (الأسماء الإلهية) کا ان کے معانی کے اختلاف کے ساتھ متعدد ہونا وارد ہوا ہے۔

> پس امر مطوی اور منشور کے درمیان ہے، جیسے کیفیت (کیف) اور کمیت (کم) مقداروں کے احوال ہیں۔
> ہمارے مرکب اپنی سادگیوں پر گم ہو گئے، ایک ایسے راز کے ساتھ امتیاز کی نیت سے جو مغلوب نہیں ہوتا۔
> اور وحی احکام لے کر نازل ہوتی ہے جنہیں وہ مشروع کرتی ہے، اور حکم منع کیے گئے اور مامور کیے گئے کے درمیان ہے۔

### [علم کیمیا دو قسموں پر ہے]

پس علمِ کیمیا، اکسیر کا علم ہے، اور یہ دو قسموں پر ہے: یعنی اس کا فعل یا تو ابتداءً کسی ذات کی تخلیق (انشاء ذات) ہے، جیسے معدنی سونا (الذهب المعدني)، یا کسی علت اور مرض کو دور کرنا ہے، جیسے صنعتی سونا (الذهب الصناعي) جو معدنی سونے کے ساتھ ملحق ہو جاتا ہے، جیسے آخرت اور دنیا کی نشأتیں اعتدال کی طلب میں ہیں۔ پس جان لو کہ تمام معدنیات ایک ہی اصل کی طرف لوٹتی ہیں، اور وہ اصل اپنی ذات سے کمال کے درجے، یعنی سونے (الذهبية) کے ساتھ ملحق ہونے کی طلبگار ہے۔ لیکن چونکہ یہ ایک طبعی امر تھا جو متنوع احکام والے الٰہی اسماء (الأسماء الإلهية) کے اثر سے تھا، اس لیے اس کے راستے میں زمانے کے اختلاف اور جگہوں کی طبیعتوں کی وجہ سے علتیں اور امراض لاحق ہو گئے، جیسے گرمی کا موسم، سردی کا موسم، خزاں کی خشکی، اور بہار کی رطوبت، اور جگہ کے اثر سے جیسے معدن کی گرمی اور سردی۔ خلاصہ یہ کہ علتیں بہت ہیں۔ پس جب اس کے سفر کے زمانوں میں اور ایک دور سے دوسرے دور میں منتقل ہونے اور ایک دائرے کے حکم سے دوسرے دائرے کے حکم سے نکلنے میں ان علتوں میں سے کوئی علت اس پر غالب آ گئی اور اس موطن کا غلبہ اس میں مستحکم ہو گیا، تو اس میں ایک صورت ظاہر ہوئی جس نے اس کے جوہر کو اس کی حقیقت سے منتقل کر دیا، تو اسے کبریت (Sulphur) یا زیبق (Mercury) کہا گیا، اور یہ دونوں ان معدنیات کے والدین ہیں جو ان کے باہم ملنے اور نکاح کرنے سے ظاہر ہوتے ہیں، جو اولاد پر طاری ہونے والی علتوں کی وجہ سے ہیں۔ پس وہ دونوں صرف اس لیے ملتے اور نکاح کرتے ہیں تاکہ ان کے درمیان ایک شریف جوہر ظاہر ہو جو نشأت میں کامل ہو اور سونا (ذهبا) کہلائے، جس سے والدین کو شرف حاصل ہو، کیونکہ وہ درجہ ہر ایک والد کی مطلوب تھی ان کی جوہریت کے لحاظ سے۔ مگر وہ اصل الٰہیات میں نفس ہے اور طبیعت میں بخار ہے۔ لیکن والدین امر اور طبیعت ہیں۔ اور ہم نے یہ اس لیے کہا کہ وہ امر والدین کو ان کی جوہریت کے لحاظ سے مطلوب تھا نہ کہ ان کی صورت کے لحاظ سے، کیونکہ ہیولائی (الجوهر الهيولائي) جوہر میں حکم صورتوں کا ہوتا ہے۔ پس جب وہ علت جو اس پر اس کی معدن میں طاری ہوئی، اس نے اسے کبریت اور زیبق بنا دیا، تو ہم نے یہ بھی جانا کہ ان کی قوت میں یہ بات ہے کہ اگر ان پر کوئی ایسی علت طاری نہ ہو جو انہیں طبائع کے اعتدال کے حکم کے غلبے سے نکال دے اور انہیں ان کے راستے سے ہٹا دے، تو ان کے درمیان سے نکلنے والی اولاد جس کی طرف ان کے اعیان تبدیل ہو جاتے ہیں، وہ کمال کے درجے سے جا ملتے ہیں، اور وہ سونا ہے جو ابتداءً ان کا مطلوب تھا۔ پس جب وہ اس خاص معدن کی طبیعت کے حکم سے اور اس میں زمانے کی طبیعت کے اثر کو قبول کرنے کے حکم سے معدن میں ملتے اور نکاح کرتے ہیں، تو وہ ایک سیدھے راستے پر ہوتے ہیں، جیسے وہ فطرت جس پر اللہ نے لوگوں کو پیدا کیا ہے۔ اور اس کے والدین ہی ہیں جو بچے کو یہودی، نصرانی یا مجوسی بناتے ہیں۔ اسی طرح، اگر اس میں ایک والد کی کمیت کسی معدنی عرض کی وجہ سے، کسی زمانی عرض سے، بڑھ جائے، تو اس سے ایک طبیعت دوسری طبیعتوں پر غالب آ جاتی ہے، تو وہ بڑھ جاتی ہے اور باقی ماندہ غالب کا مقابلہ کرنے سے قاصر ہو جاتی ہے، تو وہ جوہر پر حکم لگاتی ہے اور اسے اس طرف لوٹا دیتی ہے جو اس طبیعت کی حقیقت عطا کرتی ہے، اور اسے اعتدال کے راستے سے ہٹا دیتی ہے، جو وہ شاہراہ ہے جو تمہیں فاضلہ، سنہری، کامل شہر کی طرف لے جاتی ہے، جس میں جو داخل ہو گیا وہ اس سے کم تر حالت میں تبدیل ہونا قبول نہیں کرتا۔ پس جب وہ طبیعت اس پر غالب آ جاتی ہے، تو اس کی عین کو پلٹ دیتی ہے، تو لوہے (الحديد)، یا تانبے (النحاس)، یا قلعی (القزدير)، یا سیسے (الآنك)، یا چاندی (الفضة) کی صورت ظاہر ہوتی ہے، اس کے حکم کے مطابق جو اس پر لگایا جاتا ہے۔ اور یہیں سے تم اللہ تعالیٰ کے اس قول کو سمجھو گے جو اعتبار کے لیے ہے:
**مُخَلَّقَةٍ وغَيْرِ مُخَلَّقَةٍ** (مکمل تخلیق شدہ اور غیر مکمل تخلیق شدہ)
یعنی مکمل تخلیق شدہ، اور وہ صرف سونا ہے، اور غیر مکمل تخلیق شدہ، اور وہ باقی معدنیات ہیں۔ پس اس وقت سات سیاروں میں سے کسی ایک سیارے کی روحانیت اس کی دیکھ بھال کرتی ہے، اور وہ اس آسمان کے فرشتوں میں سے ایک فرشتہ ہے جو اس مسخر سیارے کے ساتھ اس کی گردش میں چلتا ہے، کیونکہ اللہ ہی ہے جس نے اسے اس مقصد کی طرف متوجہ کیا ہے جو اس کے خالق کے حکم سے مقصود ہے، تاکہ اس جوہر کی عین کو باقی رکھا جائے۔ پس لوہے کی صورت کی دیکھ بھال وہ فرشتہ کرتا ہے جس کا گھوڑا یہ ساتویں آسمان کا گردش کرنے والا سیارہ ہے، اور قلعی وغیرہ کی صورت کی بھی، اور اسی طرح ہر معدنی صورت کی دیکھ بھال وہ فرشتہ کرتا ہے جس کا گھوڑا اس کے خاص آسمان اور فلک میں گردش کرنے والا یہ سیارہ ہے، جسے اس کے رب تعالیٰ نے اس میں متوجہ کیا ہے۔
پس جب تدبیر کا عارف آتا ہے، تو وہ اس امر میں دیکھتا ہے جو اس کے لیے آسان ہو۔ اگر اس کے لیے آسان یہ ہو کہ جسم سے علت کو دور کر دے تاکہ اسے اس معتدل طبعی راستے پر لوٹا دے جس سے وہ ہٹ گیا تھا، تو یہ زیادہ بہتر ہے۔ کیونکہ گردش کرنے والے سیارے کو رصد کرنے والا کبھی اسی منزل میں دیکھتا ہے اور کبھی اس سے ہٹا ہوا، اس کے اوپر یا نیچے منحرف دیکھتا ہے۔ پس تدبیر کا عارف اس سبب کی طرف متوجہ ہوتا ہے جس نے اسے لوہا یا جو کچھ بھی تھا بنا دیا، اور وہ جانتا ہے کہ وہ جماعت پر صرف اس کمیت کی وجہ سے غالب آیا جو اس میں تھی، پس وہ زائد میں سے کم کرتا ہے اور ناقص میں اضافہ کرتا ہے۔ اور یہی طب ہے، اور اس پر عمل کرنے والا عالم طبیب (الطبيب) ہے۔ پس وہ اس فعل سے اس سے لوہے کی صورت، یا جو بھی صورت اس پر تھی، کو دور کر دیتا ہے۔ پس جب وہ اسے راستے پر لوٹا دیتا ہے، تو وہ اس کی صحت کی درستی اور اس پر اس کے قیام کی حفاظت کرنے لگتا ہے۔ کیونکہ وہ اپنی بیماری سے شفا پا چکا ہوتا ہے اور نقاہت کی حالت میں ہوتا ہے، تو اس پر خوف ہوتا ہے۔ پس وہ اس کے ساتھ غذاؤں میں نرمی برتتا ہے اور اسے ہواؤں سے محفوظ رکھتا ہے، اور اسے سیدھے راستے پر چلاتا ہے یہاں تک کہ وہ جوہر سونے کی صورت اختیار کر لیتا ہے۔ پس جب اسے یہ حاصل ہو جاتا ہے، تو وہ طبیب کے حکم اور اپنی علت سے باہر نکل جاتا ہے، کیونکہ اس کمال کے بعد وہ نقصان کے درجے میں نہیں اترتا اور نہ ہی اسے قبول کرتا ہے، اور اگر طبیب اس کا ارادہ بھی کرے تو وہ اس کے لیے ممکن نہیں ہوتا۔ کیونکہ قاضی کے پاس اس مسئلے میں کوئی نص نہیں ہے کہ وہ اس میں اپنی رائے کے مطابق حکم دے۔ اور اس کی حقیقت میں وجہ یہ ہے کہ قاضی عادل ہوتا ہے اور وہ صرف اسی پر حکم لگاتا ہے جو حق کے راستے سے ہٹ گیا ہو، اور یہ سونا اس پر قائم ہے، لہٰذا اس پر کوئی فیصلہ نہیں کیا جاتا، کیونکہ فریقِ مخالف کے لیے اس پر کوئی حق ثابت نہیں ہوا۔ پس یہ اس کی وجہ ہے۔ پس جو حق کے راستے پر قائم رہا، وہ اس پر حکم لگائے جانے کے درجے سے بلند ہو گیا اور چیزوں پر حاکم بن گیا۔ پس یہ علتوں کو دور کرنے کا طریقہ ہے، اور میں نے کسی کو نہیں دیکھا جو اسے جانتا ہو اور نہ ہی اس پر کسی نے تنبیہ کی ہو اور نہ ہی اشارہ کیا ہو، اور تم اسے صرف اسی باب میں یا ہمارے کلام میں پاؤ گے۔

### [اگر اس صنعت کا مالک اکسیر کی تخلیق کا ارادہ کرے]

اور اگر اس صنعت کا مالک اس عین کو تخلیق (انشاء) کرنا چاہے جسے اکسیر (إكسيرا) کہا جاتا ہے تاکہ اسے معدنی اجسام میں سے جس پر چاہے ڈالے، تو وہ اسے اس چیز میں بدل دیتا ہے جس کا حکم اس قابل جسم کی طبیعت دیتی ہے، اور دوا ایک ہی ہے جو کہ اکسیر ہے۔ پس اجسام میں سے کچھ ایسے ہیں جنہیں اکسیر اپنے حکم پر لوٹا دیتا ہے، تو وہ ایک اکسیر بن جاتا ہے جو اپنا عمل کرتا ہے، اور اسے نائب (النائب) کہا جاتا ہے۔ پس وہ باقی معدنی اجسام میں قائم ہوتا ہے اور اپنے حکم سے حکم لگاتا ہے، مثلاً وہ اکسیر کی عین سے ایک درہم یا جو بھی وزن چاہے لے، اور اسے اجسام میں سے جس جسم پر چاہے، ایک ہزار وزن پر ڈال دے۔ پس اگر وہ قلعی یا لوہا ہو تو اسے چاندی کی صورت دے دیتا ہے، اور اگر وہ تانبا یا کالا سیسہ یا چاندی ہو تو اسے سونے کی صورت دے دیتا ہے۔ اور اگر جسم زیبق ہو تو اسے اپنی قوت دے دیتا ہے اور اسے اپنا نائب چھوڑ دیتا ہے جو اجسام میں اس کا حکم لگاتا ہے، لیکن ایک ایسے وزن کے ساتھ جو باقی اجسام کے وزن سے مختلف ہوتا ہے۔ اور وہ وزن اکسیر کا ایک درہم ہوتا ہے جسے وہ خاص طور پر زیبق کے ایک رطلِ حکمت پر ڈالتا ہے، تو وہ اسے پورا اکسیر بنا دیتا ہے۔ پھر وہ اس نائب میں سے ایک وزن باقی اجسام کے ایک ہزار وزن پر ڈالتا ہے، جیسے اکسیر، تو وہ حکم میں اس کے راستے پر چلتا ہے۔ پس یہ تخلیق (الإنشاء) کی صورت ہے، اور پہلی صنعت مرض کو دور کرنے کی تھی۔ اور ہم یہ اس لیے لائے ہیں تاکہ تمہیں کیمیا (الكيمياء) کے مسمیٰ میں حکمت کے دونوں طریقوں کے باہمی ربط سے آگاہ کریں۔

### [کیمیا کو سعادت کا نام دینے کی وجہ]

اور اسے کیمیائے سعادت (كيمياء السعادة) کیوں کہا گیا؟ کیونکہ اس میں سعادت (سعادة) کا ہونا ضروری ہے، اور اس میں وہ اضافہ ہے جو اہل اللہ کے پاس لوگوں میں نہیں ہے، اور وہ یہ ہے کہ یہ تمہیں مردوں کے لیے کمال (الكمال) کا درجہ عطا کرتا ہے۔ کیونکہ ہر صاحبِ سعادت کمال عطا نہیں کرتا، پس ہر صاحبِ کمال سعید ہے، لیکن ہر سعید کامل نہیں ہے۔ اور کمال سے مراد اعلیٰ درجے سے جا ملنا ہے، اور وہ اصل سے مشابہت اختیار کرنا ہے۔ اور یہ گمان نہ کیا جائے کہ
نبی صلی اللہ علیہ وسلم کا یہ قول: **كمل من الرجال كثيرون** (مردوں میں سے بہت سے کامل ہوئے)
اس کمال سے مراد ہے جس کا ذکر لوگوں نے کیا ہے، بلکہ وہ وہی ہے جس کا ہم نے ذکر کیا ہے، اور یہ دنیا میں علمی استعداد (الاستعداد العلمي) کے مطابق ہوتا ہے۔ پس ہم ان شاء اللہ اس تمہید کے بعد کیمیائے سعادت پر بات کریں گے۔ اور اللہ ہی توفیق دینے والا ہے، اس کے سوا کوئی رب نہیں۔

### (ایک فصل میں وصل) [مطلوبہ کمال جس کے لیے انسان کو پیدا کیا گیا ہے، وہ صرف خلافت ہے]

جان لو کہ مطلوبہ کمال جس کے لیے انسان کو پیدا کیا گیا ہے، وہ صرف خلافت (الخلافة) ہے۔ پس آدم علیہ السلام نے اسے الٰہی عنایت (العناية الإلهية) کے حکم سے حاصل کیا، اور یہ رسولوں میں رسالت سے زیادہ خاص مقام ہے، کیونکہ ہر رسول خلیفہ نہیں ہوتا۔ رسالت کا درجہ صرف تبلیغ ہے، اللہ تعالیٰ فرماتا ہے:
**مَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ** (رسول پر صرف پہنچا دینا ہے)
اور اسے مخالف پر قابو پانے کا اختیار نہیں ہوتا، بلکہ اسے صرف اللہ کی طرف سے یا جو اللہ اسے دکھائے، اس کا حکم مشروع کرنے کا اختیار ہوتا ہے۔ پس جب اللہ اسے ان لوگوں پر قابو پانے کا اختیار دے جن کی طرف اسے بھیجا گیا ہے، تو وہی استخلاف اور خلافت ہے، اور وہ رسول خلیفہ ہے۔ پس ہر وہ شخص جسے بھیجا گیا، اس نے حکم نہیں لگایا۔ پس جب اسے تلوار دی جاتی ہے اور وہ فعل کو نافذ کرتا ہے، تب اسے کمال حاصل ہوتا ہے، اور وہ الٰہی اسماء (الأسماء الإلهية) کے غلبے کے ساتھ ظاہر ہوتا ہے، پس وہ عطا کرتا ہے اور روکتا ہے، عزت دیتا ہے اور ذلت دیتا ہے، زندہ کرتا ہے اور مارتا ہے، نقصان پہنچاتا ہے اور فائدہ دیتا ہے۔ اور وہ نبوت کے ساتھ تقابل کے اسماء کے ساتھ ظاہر ہوتا ہے، یہ ضروری ہے۔ پس اگر وہ نبوت کے بغیر قابو پانے کے ساتھ ظاہر ہو، تو وہ بادشاہ ہے، خلیفہ نہیں۔ پس خلیفہ صرف وہی ہو سکتا ہے جسے ذات حق (الحق) نے اپنے بندوں پر خلیفہ بنایا ہو، نہ کہ وہ جسے لوگوں نے کھڑا کیا ہو اور اس کی بیعت کی ہو اور اسے اپنے لیے اور اپنے اوپر مقدم کیا ہو۔ پس یہ کمال کا درجہ ہے۔ اور نفوس کے لیے مقامِ کمال کے حصول میں مشروع عمل ہے، لیکن نبوت کے حصول میں ان کے لیے کوئی عمل نہیں ہے۔

### [خلافت اکتسابی ہو سکتی ہے اور نبوت غیر اکتسابی]

پس خلافت (الخلافة) اکتسابی ہو سکتی ہے، اور نبوت (النبوة) اکتسابی نہیں ہے۔ لیکن جب بعض لوگوں نے اس تک پہنچنے والے راستے کو دیکھا جو حکم میں پاکیزہ ہے اور جسے اللہ چاہے اس میں چلتا ہے، تو انہوں نے گمان کیا کہ نبوت اکتسابی ہے اور غلطی کی۔ پس اس میں کوئی شک نہیں کہ راستہ اکتساب کیا جاتا ہے، لیکن جب وہ دروازے پر پہنچتا ہے، تو یہ اس توقیع (توقيع) کے مطابق ہوتا ہے جو اس کے لیے جاری ہوتا ہے۔ اور وہیں الٰہی اختصاص (الاختصاص الإلهي) ہوتا ہے۔ پس لوگوں میں سے کچھ ایسے ہیں جن کے لیے ولایت (الولاية) کی توقیع جاری ہوتی ہے، اور ان میں سے کچھ ایسے ہیں جن کے لیے نبوت، رسالت، اور رسالت و خلافت کی توقیع جاری ہوتی ہے، اور ان میں سے کچھ ایسے ہیں جن کے لیے صرف خلافت کی توقیع جاری ہوتی ہے۔ پس جب دیکھنے والے نے دیکھا کہ ان لوگوں کے لیے یہ توقیع صرف اس دروازے تک افعال، اقوال اور احوال کے ذریعے سلوک کرنے کے بعد ہی جاری ہوئی، تو اس نے گمان کیا کہ یہ بندے کے لیے اکتسابی ہے، اور اس نے غلطی کی۔

### [نفس الٰہی توقیعات کو قبول کرنے کے لیے تیار ہے]

اور جان لو کہ نفس اپنی ذات کے لحاظ سے اس استعداد کو قبول کرنے کے لیے تیار ہے جس کے ذریعے الٰہی توقیعات (التوقيعات الإلهية) جاری ہوتی ہیں۔ پس ان میں سے کچھ ایسے ہیں جنہیں صرف ولایت کی توقیع کی استعداد حاصل ہوئی، تو انہوں نے اس سے زیادہ نہیں بڑھا۔ اور ان میں سے کچھ ایسے ہیں جنہیں ان تمام مقامات یا ان میں سے بعض کی استعداد عطا کی گئی جن کا ہم نے ذکر کیا۔ اور اس کی وجہ یہ ہے کہ نفوس ایک ہی معدن سے پیدا کیے گئے ہیں، جیسا کہ اللہ تعالیٰ فرماتا ہے:
**خَلَقَكُمْ مِنْ نَفْسٍ وَاحِدَةٍ** (تمہیں ایک ہی جان سے پیدا کیا)
اور جسم کی تخلیق کی تیاری کے بعد فرمایا:
**وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِنْ رُوحِي** (اور میں نے اس میں اپنی روح پھونکی)
پس ایک ہی روح سے وہ راز صحیح ہوا جو پھونکے گئے میں پھونکا گیا، اور وہ نفس ہے۔ اور اس کا قول:
**فِي أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَا شَاءَ رَكَّبَكَ** (جس صورت میں چاہا تجھے جوڑ دیا)
